block.p: Cristina Maria Arico and James Joseph Clark were married yesterday at Le Cirque 2000, the New York restaurant. The Rev. Dr. Melvin Hawthorne, an ecumenical minister, performed the ceremony.
Mrs. Clark, 32, was until recently a consultant at the Kooper Group, an employee-benefits insurance brokerage company in New York.
Cristina Maria Arico and James Joseph Clark were married yesterday at Le Cirque 2000, the New York restaurant. The Rev. Dr. Melvin Hawthorne, an ecumenical minister, performed the ceremony.
Mrs. Clark, 32, was until recently a consultant at the Kooper Group, an employee-benefits insurance brokerage company in New York.
Mr. Clark, 42, is a partner in Cahill Gordon & Reindel, the New York law firm. He graduated from Stonehill College and received his law degree from Albany Law School.
The couple's previous marriages ended in divorce.
The bride is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Edward Juris of West Palm Beach, Fla. The bridegroom is a son of Patricia A. Clark of West Brighton, Staten Island, and the late James J. Clark 3d.
